column5: Feb 23 Macy's Inc reported a 4.3 percent decline in quarterly comparable sales  slightly better than the 4.7 percent decline the department store operator had estimated  helped by improving sales due to colder weather in January.

column4: UPDATE 1-Morgan Stanley says majority of its E&P loans to junk-rated companies
column5: Feb 23 Morgan Stanley said the majority of its loans to oil and gas exploration and production companies are to non-investment grade firms.

column4: UPDATE 1-Hong Kong's SFC sees no changes to shareholder warnings
column5: * BlackRock sees concerns over independent directors on HK boards

column4: Hong Kong see no changes to shareholder warnings after MSCI move-SFC
column5: HONG KONG  Feb 23 Hong Kong's securities regulator has no plans to change its system to warn investors of companies that have a high concentration of shareholders after MSCI Inc's move to exclude those shares from its global indices  the head of the regulator said on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. official never disclosed wife's Northrop account -documents
column5: WASHINGTON  Feb 22 A U.S. Air Force arms buyer under investigation for violating financial disclosure rules never reported his wife's retirement account with Northrop Grumman Corp after their marriage in 2008  public disclosure forms seen by Reuters showed.

column4: Raytheon teams with Finmeccanica to bid for U.S. Air Force deal
column5: WASHINGTON  Feb 22 Raytheon Co  a top U.S. weapons maker  on Monday said it would team up with Finmeccanica SpA to offer a variant of the Italian company's Aermacchi M-346 jets in an upcoming U.S. Air Force competition for 350 new training planes.

column4: Oracle buys Israeli cloud company Ravello
column5: TEL AVIV Business software maker Oracle Corp  which is seeking to expand its cloud business  has agreed to buy Israeli cloud software company Ravello Systems  the two firms said on their websites on Tuesday.

column4: Oracle buys Israeli cloud company Ravello
column5: TEL AVIV  Feb 23 Business software maker Oracle Corp  which is seeking to expand its cloud business  has agreed to buy Israeli cloud software company Ravello Systems  the two firms said on their websites on Tuesday.

column4: Brazil's Petrobras to stop onshore drilling rigs in 6 states -Valor
column5: SAO PAULO  Feb 23 Brazil's state-run Petroleo Brasileiro SA plans to shut down onshore drilling rigs in at least six states because of the low price of oil  newspaper Valor Economico reported on Tuesday  citing a source with knowledge of the operations.

column4: Raytheon teams with Finmeccanica to bid for U.S. Air Force deal

column4: Investor opposes Shaw-Corus deal  Corus vote due March 9
column5: TORONTO Corus Entertainment Inc  could face a shareholder revolt against plan by its controlling family to buy media assets from a related company  Shaw Communications Inc   a wrinkle that could also complicate Shaw's wireless strategy.

column4: Investor opposes Shaw-Corus deal  Corus vote due March 9
column5: TORONTO  Feb 23 Corus Entertainment Inc  could face a shareholder revolt against plan by its controlling family to buy media assets from a related company  Shaw Communications Inc  a wrinkle that could also complicate Shaw's wireless strategy.

column4: U.S. top court mulls boosted patent damages in Stryker  Halo cases
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday signaled a willingness to give federal judges more discretion to boost penalties for patent infringement as the justices heard arguments in cases brought by Stryker Corp and Halo Electronics Inc.

column4: U.S. top court mulls boosted patent damages in Stryker  Halo cases

column4: BRIEF-Taiwan's TSMC orders equipment for T$2.7 bln
column5: * Says orders equipment from M+W High Tech Projects Taiwan Co Ltd and United Integrated Services Co Ltd for T$2.7 billion  ($81.25 million)

column4: Spanish stocks - Factors to watch on Tuesday
column5: MADRID  Feb 23 The following Spanish stocks may be affected by newspaper reports and other factors on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified the newspaper reports  and cannot vouch for their accuracy:

column4: UPDATE 2-Tenet posts loss on higher legal reserves; outlook in line
column5: Feb 22 Tenet Healthcare Corp on Monday reported a net loss in the fourth quarter tied to an increase in legal reserves and softer in-patient admissions to its hospitals  but issued a 2016 forecast that was in line with analysts' expectations.

column4: Judge lets whistleblower case over Teva speaker program proceed
column5: A whistleblower lawsuit accusing Teva Pharmaceuticals of using a sham educational speakers program to pay kickbacks to doctors for prescribing its Parkinson's disease and multiple sclerosis drugs can go forward  a Manhattan federal judge has ruled.

column4: Toll Brothers says home orders point to strong spring sales
column5: Toll Brothers Inc   the largest U.S. luxury homebuilder  said it expected higher demand in the all-important spring selling season  suggesting that a recovery in the U.S. housing market remained intact despite a massive stock market sell-off and slowing economic growth.

column4: UPDATE 2-Toll Brothers says home orders point to strong spring sales
column5: * Shares rise as much as 4.7 pct   (Adds details from conference call  analyst's comment)

column4: Toll Brothers quarterly revenue rises 8.8 pct
column5: Feb 23 Toll Brothers Inc  the largest U.S. luxury homebuilder  reported an 8.8 percent rise in quarterly revenue as it sold homes at higher prices.

column4: Honeywell does not see regulatory hurdles for United Tech deal
column5: Aerospace component supplier Honeywell International Inc  confirmed on Tuesday that it had engaged in deal talks with United Technologies Corp  over the past year  and said it did not see regulatory process as a "material obstacle" to the deal.

column4: UPDATE 1-Honeywell does not see regulatory hurdles for United Tech deal

column4: United Tech says a deal with Honeywell would face major challenges
column5: United Technologies Corp  on Monday disclosed merger talks with fellow aerospace component supplier Honeywell International Inc  but said a deal would "face insurmountable regulatory obstacles."

column4: Valeant shares jump 9 percent after announcement of plans to restate
column5: Shares of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  rose 9 percent on Tuesday  the morning after the drugmaker said a board committee investigation into its dealings with distributor Philidor Rx Services would result in a profit restatement.

column4: UPDATE 1-J&J must pay $72 mln for cancer death linked to talcum powder - lawyers
column5: Feb 23 Johnson & Johnson was ordered by a Missouri state jury to pay $72 million of damages to the family of a woman whose death from ovarian cancer was linked to her use of the company's talc-based Baby Powder and Shower to Shower for several decades.

column4: Valeant shares recover a bit after two-day slide
column5: Feb 23 Shares of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc were up more than 6 percent in early U.S. trading on Tuesday following a two-day selloff  with some analysts saying that selling of the Canadian drugmaker's stock had been overdone.

column4: Valeant to restate results after Philidor review
column5: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  said it would restate its financial results for 2014 and 2015 after identifying some sales to Philidor that should have been recognized when products were dispensed to patients.

column4: UPDATE 2-Western Union quizzed by EU on money transfer activities
column5: BRUSSELS  Feb 23 - U.S. money transfer services provider Western Union has been questioned by antitrust regulators over its activities in Europe  focusing on whether agreements with its agents are anti-competitive.
